sourceMeaningMnemonic: There was once a <radical>melon</radical> <radical>child</radical>, that is, a child with the body of a melon. When he was born, his parents didn't want him, so he became an <kanji>orphan</kanji>.
meaningInfo: The "melon boy orphan," is what they called him. Imagine a melon (your favorite kind) with a face and arms and legs sticking out. He walks up to you and says "hello kind person, could you help an orphan?"
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>orphan</kanji> melon boy is but a <ja><reading>子</reading></ja> (<ja>こ</ja>).
readingInfo: That's the sad thing about the melon orphan boy... he's just a child. "Hello gov, I'm just a child," he says to you.
